channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Haiti, Jamaica and Cuba pick up the pieces after Melissa's destruction
item.description: Communities across the northern Caribbean are dealing with the aftermath of Hurricane Melissa. The storm has left many without homes, power or communication.
item.content:encoded:
Communities across the northern Caribbean are dealing with the aftermath of Hurricane Melissa. The storm has left many without homes, power or communication.

(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Why an interstellar comet has scientists excited
item.description: The comet could be older than our solar system. The comet is also distinct because nickel vapor was detected in the gas surrounding it.
item.content:encoded:
The comet could be older than our solar system. The comet is also distinct because nickel vapor was detected in the gas surrounding it.

(Image credit: NASA/European Space Agency)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: The federal government is still shut down. Here's what that means across the country
item.description: The federal government shutdown continues. Republicans and Democrats appear no closer to an agreement to end it. Many federal workers are missing full paychecks and don't know when they will resume.
item.content:encoded:
The federal government shutdown continues. Republicans and Democrats appear no closer to an agreement to end it. Many federal workers are missing full paychecks and don't know when they will resume.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: The NPR Network

item.title: Judge sentences former Jan. 6 defendant for hoax threat near Obama's home
item.description: Taylor Taranto's sentencing for time served comes as storming of the U.S. Capitol in 2021 continues to reverberate inside the Justice Department under the Trump administration.
item.content:encoded:
Taylor Taranto's sentencing for time served comes as storming of the U.S. Capitol in 2021 continues to reverberate inside the Justice Department under the Trump administration.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Go behind the scenes at a New Jersey Spirit Halloween store
item.description: Each year, about 1,400 Spirit Halloween shops pop up across the U.S. Two student journalists, Isabel Jacobson and Adam Sanders, visited their local shop to meet the spirited employees who work there.
item.content:encoded: Each year, about 1,400 Spirit Halloween shops pop up across the U.S. Two student journalists, Isabel Jacobson and Adam Sanders, visited their local shop to meet the spirited employees who work there.
item.dc:creator: Student Podcast Challenge

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of his titles and evicts him from the Royal Lodge
item.description: Buckingham Palace said the king's brother will be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor and not as a prince, and he will move from his Royal Lodge residence into "private accommodation."
item.content:encoded:
Buckingham Palace said the king's brother will be known as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor and not as a prince, and he will move from his Royal Lodge residence into "private accommodation."

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 4 GOP senators join Democrats to rebuke Trump on tariffs for a third time this week
item.description: A handful of Republicans joined Democrats to vote against President Trump's emergency tariffs against Brazil, Canada and other countries. But the votes were mostly symbolic and unlikely to become law.
item.content:encoded:
A handful of Republicans joined Democrats to vote against President Trump's emergency tariffs against Brazil, Canada and other countries. But the votes were mostly symbolic and unlikely to become law.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: A judge is set to decide whether SNAP benefits can be cut off on Saturday
item.description: A Boston federal judge suggested she was not persuaded by the Trump administration's argument that it is legally barred from using a USDA emergency fund to keep the SNAP benefits coming.
item.content:encoded:
A Boston federal judge suggested she was not persuaded by the Trump administration's argument that it is legally barred from using a USDA emergency fund to keep the SNAP benefits coming.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith

item.title: Trump administration sets lowest-ever cap on refugee admissions to U.S.
item.description: The lowest cap on refugees since the program was established in 1980 comes as the U.S. prioritizes resettling Afrikaners from South Africa.
item.content:encoded:
The lowest cap on refugees since the program was established in 1980 comes as the U.S. prioritizes resettling Afrikaners from South Africa.

(Image credit: Farooq Naeem)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Judge sets trial over whether CPB pulled back from NPR due to White House pressure
item.description: NPR alleges that CPB unlawfully yanked away a planned three-year contract worth $36 million in the face of intense pressure from the White House to sever ties with the radio network.
item.content:encoded:
NPR alleges that CPB unlawfully yanked away a planned three-year contract worth $36 million in the face of intense pressure from the White House to sever ties with the radio network.

(Image credit: Allison Shelley/Allison Shelley)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik
